page.title: 19All Saints' Church
page.content: This stone-built church, with its tall tower, stands at one end of the main road. This area was once the ancient parish of{Tatenhill}and the church was the gift of{Michael Thomas {Bass M.P.,}the Burton brewer. It was built in 1867 to the design of{William {Butterfield.}Taylors of Loughborough supplied the peal of five bells. In 1884{Rangemore}became a parish and the church was consecrated and dedicated to All Saints'. In 1885 the church was extended by {Michael Arthur Bass}who was the first Baron Burton. This later work was designed by{G.F.Bodley.} There are many memorials to the Bass family within the church and its patron is the present{Lord Burton.} The rector, who lives in the nearby vicarage, is also rector of neighbouring{Tatenhill}and{Dunstall.}
